messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] PC Games/ Sims and AOE
messages.msgSnippet: ... Nope. Get them all. I ve decided that most of the suggested age ranges on games (board and computer) are a crock. The only issue is some reading and
messages.messageBody:
On Fri, 07 Sep 2001 09:42:36 -0400 Ann <hooperck@...> writes:
> Sims....
> What is a good one to start with?
> My kids are 8, 6 and 5 if that matters.
> And What about Age of Empires? Think this is too old for us?
> Ann

Nope. Get them all. I've decided that most of the suggested age ranges
on games (board and computer) are a crock. The only issue is some reading
and writing, but if you're in earshot it should be fine. I know many 5 yr
olds who play them successfully. Cacie played many games for ages 10+ at
half that age....

The Sims is nice in that you can start with a one-person family if you
want an easier game...

Daron

Sims....
What is a good one to start with?
My kids are 8, 6 and 5 if that matters.
And What about Age of Empires? Think this is too old for us?
Ann
